intro: Amorphophallus borneensis var. winkleri, commonly known as the Winkler's Bornean arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to Borneo. It belongs to the Araceae family and is characterized by its large,戟-shaped (spear-shaped) leaves. The plant produces a striking, spadix-like inflorescence that can reach up to 2 meters in height. It is adapted to grow in humid, shaded environments within lowland rainforests. Its tuberous roots are used in traditional medicine and as a starch source in some regions.
